message:
"By the process of applying mind and intelligence to yoga, one can attain equanimity in the wake of favourable and unfavourable outcomes of various actions, therefore strive for yoga, yoga is the perfection of work." (Gita 2.50)

“Yogah Karmasu Kaushalam” the motto of IIT Kharagpur and a verse of the Bhagwad Gita translates to “excellence in work is yoga”. Do we really know what does it stand for? Well if you haven't given it a thought yet now's the time to sit back and reflect a little at the deeper meaning of this small verse which defines us and sets us apart as Kgpians.

This beautifully written text by professor Mrigank Sharad stimulates us to elevate our understanding of life and leaves us much wiser than before.

https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/iit-kharagpurs-motto-revisited-mrigank-sharad/?fbclid=IwAR0mItQK-abfITfRbuVObaUtGax53kvK9__rBY-qBCe_VjiHI1ShTHhIEdE

The Department Change Talk conducted by Student Welfare Group was held on Saturday, 6th April, which witnessed a very informative session on the current academic curriculum and future opportunities of various departments. Our esteemed panelists addressed the gathering and provided insights into their journey before and after securing much-coveted department changes, and cleared doubts on topics ranging from research opportunities to involvements in extra-curricular activities. 
Here are some highlights from the Panel Discussion.

Hola freshers!!
With Endsem approaching in just about two weeks it is the right time to gear up for your preparation and clear all your doubts. PDS doubt session for UG 1st year student is going to be held today (Sunday). Do attend the session as we plan to provide you a short recap of some of the important topics and make you practice with tutorials designed specifically for Endsem.
Timings:6:00-8:00 pm
Venue: F-132 (Main Building)
Be there!!

Dear First-Yearites,
We are finally here with what we promised. For all those aiming for a department change, we offer you an opportunity to make an informed choice.
Come, discuss your opinions and doubts with a panel of 3rd-year prime students who made a department change after their first year. Learn, what factors did they considered while choosing the branch and what they're up to now.
Do come with all your questions to brainstorm our panelists.
Be on time. See ya!

Venue: V2, Vikramshila
Time: 6:10 pm onwards

Design credits: Tanmay Das

"Mentors provide professional networks, outlets for frustration, college and career counseling, general life advice, and most importantly, an extra voice telling a student they are smart enough and capable enough to cross the stage at graduation."

Student Welfare Group - SWG, IIT Kharagpur presents before you an opportunity to become a Mentor for the upcoming freshers batch of 2019 so as to guide them in their journey at KGP using your own experience in the campus. It is applicable for a BTech or a Dual Degree student currently in their second year and for a dual degree student currently in their third year of study.
Register here: http://bit.ly/SMPmentor19

Google Summer of Code(GSoC) is an annual global program focussed towards bringing student developers into open source software development. There are several people in the campus who are aspiring for it this year and are looking forward to fundas from those who had cleared GSoc in the last year. 
Student Welfare Group presents before you the interview of Dhiraj Barnwal, a third-year undergraduate student of Industrial and Systems Engineering Department, who had cleared GSoc in 2018. 
http://swgiitkgp.in/foresight/dhiraj-kumar_gsoc/

For all the UPSC aspirants out there!
Since the notification for this year is on, many of you might be in some dilemma. To your rescue, Student Welfare Group brings a seminar on Career in Civil Services in association with NEXT IAS. 
The guest speaker for the evening will be Mr. Shubham Aggarwal (IRS-2016, IPS-2017). Shubham is a Computer Science Engineer from NIT Allahabad and started his preparation for the Civil Services Exam early in his college years. Soon after college, he appeared for the UPSC CSE exam and has achieved back to back success in it.
Do carry all your doubts and get them clarified with him. Do not miss this sincere chance.
See you!
Venue: V2, Vikramshila
Time & Date: 5:45 pm, 14th March

Design credits: Kunal Das

Shubham is a Computer Science Engineer from NIT Allahabad and started his preparation for the Civil Services Exam early in his college years. Soon after college, he appeared for the UPSC CSE exam and has achieved back to back success in it.
Do carry all your doubts and get them clarified with him. Do not miss this sincere chance.
See you!
Venue: V2, Vikramshila
Time & Date: 5:45 pm, 14th March

Design credits: Kunal Das

Internship & Live Project | Industry Exposure | Stipend & Certificate Provided | Flexible Work Hours (2-3 hrs in a day)

Apply Here: https://www.awign.com/internships/netmeds/r/pritam9383ca

1. Project Name: Customer Acquisition for NetMeds
2. Stipend: ₹7000 in 3 weeks (plus performance based bonuses & incentives)
3. Certificate will be provided upon successful completion of the project
4. Duration: Min 3 weeks
5. Flexible Timings: Work as per your timings (Min 12 hrs a week)
6. Online training from IIT/IIM alumni, before starting the project 
7. Pre-Placement Interview: Only for exceptional performers

Every noble soul is requested to come forward and register for the same. Let us all be prepared, as emergencies may arise at any time.

Data Science is one of the most sought-after technologies today, with its applications ranging from the Agricultural sector to the IT industry. While there are numerous tools available for practicing data science, Python is by far the most widely used, as a result of its easy syntax and the large number of powerful libraries available at one's disposal. 

Student Welfare Group presents its annual workshop on 'Python for Data Science' in collaboration with Indian Cyber Security Solutions.

Venue- NC 141
Date - Sunday (3rd March, 2019)
Time - 10 AM - 6 PM ( with a 45 min lunch break )

Register at - https://bit.ly/2HfnJK3

Is love only meant to be shared between a couple? Is it only limited to a day when you spare out some time out of your daily routine to make someone feel special?
Love has a lot of forms. It can be between two friends, between a mother and a son, and even between a pet and its owner. So this Valentine's Day, let's celebrate each and every form of love under this sky. Let's take out time for them not just today, but whenever they need our presence. 
Student Welfare Group - SWG, IIT Kharagpur wishes you a Happy Valentine's Day! ❤️
Design Credits: Tapasya Pratap Singh

message:
Hey folks! 
The wait is finally over. SWG brings to you Placement Talk 2019.
Get a chance to have one-on-one interaction with some of the placed KGPians, who stood out during placements with flying colors in their respective profiles. Along with their Fundas for placements, they will discuss how one can be the best version of himself/herself and finally achieve their dream goal. Be a part of the event to find out as to what made them different.
Also, bring all your queries and hold them with your questions/doubts. 
See you in V4, 6th February at 6:30 pm!
Design Credits: Tanmay Das

That is why we at SWG bring to you few Fundae from people who have faced the placement season and emerged victoriously; and are also a part of our ‘Placement Talk’, a panel discussion coming soon to clear all your doubts and show you how to make the right choices at the right time.

message:
The Mentor Mentee Meeting took place in the last semester and it was overwhelming to see the way it panned out with all mentors acing their responsibility and the mentees interacting with their mentors with a lot of interest. With the advent of the new semester its time for the mentors and the mentees to reconnect and meet with each other at any place and time of your choice to increase the bonding amongst yourself. You not only have to meet but the mentors will also have to click a selfie of your group and upload it in the following link: http://bit.ly/VM3selfie or send it as a message to our page. 
Make the most of this opportunity and make this Virtual Mentor Mentee Meeting as fun and cheerful as possible. 
Send in your selfies by 27th January
Design Credit: Shubham Hansda

With the advent of the new year, we need new people to energize our team and bring a fresh new outlook full of enthusiasm. IWG and SWG have come together to work in unity for the betterment of KGP and we want you, dear freshers, to come and be a part of our family and continue this legacy. We want to tell you all about us and would like to know what ideas you have to make our campus a happier place.

Student Welfare Group - SWG, IIT Kharagpur shared Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur's post. A circular has been issued by Registrar, IIT Kharagpur appealing students, staffs and everyone else in the campus to cooperate in making KGP campus plastic free. Shops at Tech Market and other shops elsewhere have been asked to stop selling plastic bags. We have also experienced a few canteens and hall shops refusing to give plastic bags after purchase. This initiative taken is visionary but its impact depends on how we all are likely to contribute towards this cause.

It is again that time of the year when most of the people in their last year will be having high aspirations to get placed in their dream company. While everyone is busy in their preparation for placement, we from Student Welfare Group would be happy to provide a helping hand to them by releasing interviews of KGP alumni, who have been placed in different companies last year, so that they can share their experience and those sitting for placements can get a better idea of how to prepare for different companies. 

In the series of our Foresight posts for Placements, we are releasing the interview of Abhinav Agarwalla, who got placed in Microsoft, in the last year.

As Placement Season is approaching, Student Welfare Group - SWG, IIT Kharagpur in collaboration with Communiqué IIT Kharagpur in association with Academia English brings Placement Drive for the final year students. The workshop will cover various aspects of Effective Communication and Written Skills.
All final year students of UG and PG courses are invited to attend this free workshop. Registration link- 
https://goo.gl/forms/XsIk3yUKkFE6a4C63
Limited Seats available.
Details of the event are-
Venue- V3, Vikramshilla
Date- 28/10/18
Time- 2-6 pm.

We pay our humble tribute to the Apostle of peace and non-violence on Gandhi Jayanti. We are constantly guided by Bapu’s ideas and the path shown by him for creating a just and equitable society without any discrimination and empowerment of every section.

On this auspicious day, let us all pledge to work together to realize Mahatma Gandhi’s vision for a progressive, peaceful and harmonious Nation. To the man who inspired a country to freedom, we bow our heads. Happy Gandhi Jayanti!

Investment Grants- Transform your Ideas to working Prototypes/Products

If you have a great innovative idea and are looking for funding, then Amrita TBI PRAYAS is the perfect platform to transform your ideas into prototypes/products. Amrita TBI PRAYAS is a unique initiative by Amrita TBI and supported by NIDHI, NSTEDB, Department of Science and Technology, Government of India to find and provide grants to the most promising ideas/startups in India.

Total grant outlay up to INR 1,00,00,000

Apply now:  http://bit.ly/newprayaas
More details : amritatbi.com/prayas.html
Submission Deadline: September 29, 2018

Amrita TBI PRAYAS program will provide a grant of up to Rs 10 Lakhs per recipient.

message:
A big THANKS to all the harbingers and imparters of knowledge and wisdom.
To our parents, who were our only teachers when we began this adventure called life.
To that pet dog we had, who taught us to be brave and love unconditionally.
To the school teachers and college profs who opened up a whole new universe of words and equations before us.
To our friends who taught us things that books couldn't.
To all those people who chose the wrong paths, because they taught us to choose the right one.
And to the one who holds infinite knowledge, the eternal teacher named 'Time'.
Wishing you all a very Happy Teacher's Day, because whether you remember it or not, each of you has taught someone something at sometime. So keep learning, keep teaching!
Design Credits: Shubham Hansda

Aimed to help students who are unable to cope up with the English medium of Communication & Exchange, we want you all to encourage your fellow friends suffering from the same to attend the session.

Didn’t we all steal our favourite food from the high racks in the kitchen?
Didn’t we play for hours on end with our neighbourhood friends?
Didn’t we fight our own invisible monsters that lurked in every dark corner of home?
Didn’t we seek adventures against elders’ warnings?
And didn’t we too grew up teasing and pulling ponies of girls?
Wasn’t our mother as frustrated with our notorious deeds as much as Yashoda with Krishna’s?
If the audacity of our errant childhood has been so similar to Krishna’s...
Let his radiance and righteousness shine in our youth too. 
Wishing you all a very happy Janmashtami.
Design Credits: Tanmay Das

Hola freshers!!
With midsem approaching in just about two weeks it is the right time to gear up for your preparation and clear all your doubts. PDS doubt session for UG 1st year student is going to be held on all Saturdays and Sundays starting from 1st September 2018. Do attend the session as we plan to provide you a short recap of some of the important topics and make you practice with tutorials designed specifically for midsem. 
Timings:6:00-8:00pm
Venue: F-234 (Main Building)
Be there!!

When I look back at the way we used to fight, I feel we would have never become anything close to friends, but apparently, we weren't given a choice. 
Dear sibling,
Thank you for all that you have been!
A support since ever, even if mostly unseen.
Every time when I fell, you consoled me.
In the blazing world, you are like a shady tree.
Seemingly distant but you were always near.
Maybe I never told you, but you were always dear! ❤
Poetry credits: Rachana Verma

message:
Hey Freshers!!
We have something for you.
What to do, what not to do... Best books, best food, best hangout locations & best fundae. The best people who can guide you to make the most out of your stay at KGP are your seniors. But, how to reach them??
Student Welfare Group brings you the opportunity to know more about the Student Mentor Program. An interactive session of all the 1st Year UG Students with the SWG Team will be held on 9th August, Thursday at Kalidas Auditorium. See you there!

So this friendship day, you owe it all to your friend(s). Let them know! ❤

JBNSTS has been one of the reputed scholarships which has been awarded to many eminent personalities and distinguished talents which includes the likes of our own Director Sir as well. Since the last date to fill up the form is tomorrow, students are requested to do the same as soon as possible.

JBNSTS has been one of the reputed scholarships which has been awarded to many eminent personalities and distinguished talents which includes the likes of our own Director Sir as well. Since the last date to fill up the form is tomorrow, students are requested to do the same as soon as possible.

message:
As we all know, KGP is all about people. The images of the Main Building, the Insti Tower or the Nalanda Classroom Complex may fade away with time, but one won't forget those bhaat sessions with their own squad of friends at Chhedis, or Veggies. They will always cherish those lovely moments spent on the 2.2 during their stay at KGP.  
For someone who is graduating from KGP in 2018, dedicate a line or two along with a picture of them with you. They can be someone from your juniors, batchmates, or seniors; but if you have some memories and a message for them, fill this form up. We will release all such entries from our page on the Convocation Day.
What better gift than giving back those "Yaadgaar" moments to them?
https://goo.gl/forms/jG6SAbJewIG64tUf1

Whether you fall or fail, whether you cry or sob, all you can look forward to is that your dad believes in you. He picks you up, brushes you off, and lets you try again." There is no one in your life like your father who protects you, keeps pushing you forward, stresses on the fundamentals and teaches you responsibility. Student Welfare Group - SWG, IIT Kharagpur celebrates these real life heroes and wishes them a Happy Father's Day.

message:
Hey,

As you know, we have launched the app of our startup "Rhymly" that helps you search rhymes & meanings of common Hindi words, create original couplets & discover kick-ass content every day.

I'll be obliged if you could take out some valuable time of yours to check out the app, give me personal feedback on it & share it via your FB timeline.

Download Link: http://bit.ly/RhymlyAppFB

 ~ Anybody Can Rhyme

Student Welfare Group - SWG, IIT Kharagpur shared Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur's post. Pavan Kumar Maddala, a first year UG student from the Department of Mechanical Engineering is suffering from hearing problem since his childhood. This problem has severely affected his first year at IIT Kgp as he was unable to listen to the lectures. Now, as suggested by the doctors he is in immediate need of a surgery failing to which he could lose his hearing ability forever. This surgery costs INR 10 lakhs. Considering the fact that he belongs to a poor background, the arrangement of this amount needs our immediate help. We urge the student community to come together and help this needy KGPian! For donation and details please visit- https://www.ketto.org/fundraiser/Helppavankumar#/action/edit

message:
We lost few of our friends over a period of time. Every time we lose someone we remember their deeds... We remember how their mere presence was an integral part of our daily lives. Even though we do not know the person but the loss of their life feels like a loss of one's own family member. It does have an effect on each one of us in some way or the other.  
We, from our side, have always tried our best to maintain the deserved harmony but, can this be achieved by the sole effort of one??? 
This small video by Rakesh Tiwari makes us realize how all of us can take care of the society, how our small chitchat can make someone feel better, how our actions influence others and what drives the emotions within.
Ruminate...
story: Student Welfare Group (SWG)  IIT Kharagpur is with Spill Poetry.

story: Student Welfare Group (SWG)  IIT Kharagpur is with Spill Poetry.

message:
We lost few of our friends over a period of time. Every time we lose someone we remember their deeds... We remember how their mere presence was an integral part of our daily lives. Even though we do not know the person but the loss of their life feels like a loss of one's own family member. It does have an effect on each one of us in some way or the other.  
We, from our side, have always tried our best to maintain the deserved harmony but, can this be achieved by the sole effort of one??? 
This small video by Rakesh Tiwari makes us realize how all of us can take care of the society, how our small chitchat can make someone feel better, how our actions influence others and what drives the emotions within.
Ruminate...

message: Student Welfare Group (SWG) IIT Kharagpur shared a group. Student Welfare Group (SWG) IIT Kharagpur present to you the Official IIT Kharagpur's JEE Counseling Group. This group intends to solve your doubts regarding any information about courses offered at IIT KGP, future prospects related to different fields, placements' data and campus environment extended here at IIT Kharagpur. Post all your doubts and queries in this group and there are many seniors out there in the group who will be more than happy to answer all your queries. We hope to contribute our part effectively to let you make an informed and right decision. Happy Counselling!!

Avijit Saha, a student at the Department of Aerospace Engineering, has been awarded the prestigious ASME IGTI Student Scholarship of USD 2000 for the academic year 2017-18. Arduino is an open-source computer hardware that designs and manufactures microcontroller kits for building digital devices and interactive objects that can sense and control objects in the physical world. Arduino has become one of the pillars of the maker movement thanks to its wonderful design and ease of use.
Student Welfare Group (SWG) IIT Kharagpur in association with Mechatron Robotic provides you with a golden opportunity to get going into the fascinating loop of digital electronics. Register fast so that you can receive the software and relevant materials in advance.
Registration is on a first come first serve basis and we have limited seats.
So hurry up and book your seats fast to get empowered with a new and exciting skill.
Register yourself in the link given below:
https://goo.gl/S1eJqU

YourDost is finally here guys!

YourDOST is an online counseling and emotional support platform designed to foster mental wellness

Here are the steps you need to follow for registration:
1) Please visit the site(www.yourdost.com).
Make sure you are connected to the IIT kgp wifi, only then you access the services for free. Although once you are registered from here, you can use its services from anywhere. 
2) You can sign up with any email id and put up any username of your choice. There are various career experts, life coaches and counsellors present. You can anonymously chat with any of them.
3) Voice call and video call can also be arranged by booking an appointment from website itself. 

Every chat, voice and video call is accessible and it's totally an anonymous platform.
